67. Datatypes


Up: Contents Next: Derived Datatypes Previous: Null Processes

Basic datatypes were introduced in Section Message Data Message Data on page Message Data and in Section Data Type Matching and Data Conversion Data Type Matching and Data Conversion on page Data Type Matching and Data Conversion . In this chapter, this model is extended to describe any data layout. We consider general datatypes that allow one to transfer efficiently heterogeneous and noncontiguous data. We conclude with the description of calls for explicit packing and unpacking of messages.
